content.body: The tests we have so far don't test for that, no. But it could make sense to add some, possibly in a different part of the test suite

I was talking with a colleague that is trying to solve (in a proprietary product, I believe) the problem of "given a stack trace, how do I tell what source map version to use for the files linked in it"

And I wonder whether with debug IDs `error.stack` could become something like
```
Error!
  at /file1.js (line:col) [debug id]
  at /file2.js (line:col) [debug id]
```
content.formatted_body:
And I wonder whether with debug IDs error.stack could become something like

  at /file1.js (line:col) [debug id]
  at /file2.js (line:col) [debug id]

content.body: Even though I know that the contents of `error.stack` are not defined anywhere
content.formatted_body: Even though I know that the contents of error.stack are not defined anywhere
